main.name: Liuming Huang
main.description: 4th year Computer Science & Data Science student studying in University of Toronto
main.bio: I'm a fourth-year Computer Science & Data Science student with strong problem-solving skills and a desire to explore the tech industry. I love working on new frameworks and making software accessible to all. Proven quick learner with the ability to work under pressure both independently and in a team as seen in the co-op role. Always eager to learn and striving to improve!
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: I always interested in playing aroung with new technologies but these are the ones that have really won me over

description: Double specialist in Computer Science and Data Science
Deanâ€™s List Scholar in the Faculty of Arts and Science

work.title: QA Automation Engineer Co-op
description: Built automation framework using Selenium and C# to automate testing of web applications
Created new helper functions by using REST API to generate test data, and improved average 50% running time reduction during each test run
Collaborated closely with Developer, DevOps, PM to allocate resources and triage on customer tickets
Led a team of two to work closely with scrum team members to evangelize an emphasis on quality through the entire SDLC
Assessed and analyzed user stories and participated in sprint planning, review sessions, scrum meetings and developed test cases, test data and test reports
Created and managed defect tracking using JIRA. Maintained QA dashboards for up to date test reports  and test status in JIRA
Document test cases and instructions to be executed by manual teams

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have used Git for version control in small teams and have toyed around with contributing to Open Source Projects.

skills.name: Java
skills.description: Java was my first programming language that I started using in college years ago. It is by far the language I am most familiar with in terms of data-structure and algorithm programming.

skills.name: React Js
skills.description: I am fairly new to React and really did not like it at first. It has grown on me though and I will continue to use it going forward. I have built a ReactJS based resume-website template (link below in portfolio) which I used as a starting point for this personal site.

skills.name: Meteor JS
skills.description: I enjoy MeteorJS for it's ease of configuration and its ability to get a full stack prototype up and running quickly. I used MeteorJS in a team for a Startup Programming class in UVIC in conjunction with React to build the MVP for Smirkspace (below in portfolio)

skills.name: Node JS
skills.description: Node JS is my server-side scripting language of choice. The bulk of my experience with it has been in conjunction with MeteorJS-based projects

skills.name: Bootstrap 4
skills.description: I use Bootstrap more often than not when designing the layout for my sites. It is the framework I am most familiar with and can therefore design more quickly than with others.

skills.name: MongoDB
skills.description: I have used many different database systems and am better educated and experienced with Relational Databases. However, for many applications, the ease of use of MongoDB better suits my needs and it is much more enjoyable to work with

skills.name: Heroku
skills.description: I use Heroku as my hosting platform for most of my projects because so far they are all unpaid and their free tier is convenient. I also appreciate its integration with Github for such simple deployment.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
